item.description: Apologies for typos in the transcript, although ‚Äúspace shit‚Äù is maybe appropriate.
Does this count as ‚Äúmaking my own entertainment‚Äù? (The adventure game was disappointing)

media:content.media:description: screenshots from asking ChatGPT what would happen if C-3PO was replaced with Alien. The answer includes ‚Äúthe Alien would likely bring a different, more aggressive energy to the group‚Äù, which I think we can agree with.
screenshot of asking ChatGPT to create a Red Dwarf themed adventure game. It prevented me from taking the clothes of a hologram.

item.description: I was adamant that I wouldn't add any smart plugs to the house. But it's been fun timeshifting charging to the low-demand/off-peak hours.
The sun was too bright to look at this morning, so looked west and there was a lovely moon.

media:content.media:description: looking onto Hove lawns, with a silver circular disk of the moon in the sky. The photo is pretty poor quality, as the person taking it zoomed too much.

item.description:
Looks like a lot of fun for anyone looking for a #phd programme in #ai (biomimetic embodied AI at that ‚Äî #brains, #robots, behaviour). Deadline in 17 days...

https://fosstodon.org/@drtnowotny/109817381705394513

TIL I like printmaking from the work of Gwen Raverat and onwards (so, early 1900s). Thank you V&A.

https://collections.vam.ac.uk/item/O827253/spring-morning-print-raverat-gwen/

A visit to the ASMR exhibit at the Design Museum. Yes, of course there was a Bob Ross room (as part of the unintentional ASMR section of the exhibit).

https://designmuseum.org/exhibitions/weird-sensation-feels-good-the-world-of-asmr

media:content.media:description: An area partly enclosed by cream coloured soft walls, bending in like hands or waves. There are three large TV screens showing ASMR works. Groups of people, in twos and threes, sit on the soft cushioning wearing headsets, the cables stretching to the screens. No one is wearing shoes.

An entry in the programme, describing a video: ‚ÄúASMR can be triggered by watching someone explain something. In 1988, the Icelandic artist Bj√∂rk was the lead singer of The Sugarcubes. In this film, which was part of a documentary made about the band, Bork describes how a television works. Her softly spoken description is accompanied by a close-up shot of her finger tracing the inside of a cathode-ray tube television set. The success of an ASM work is often determined by the relationship a viewer has to the ASMRtist through the screen. In this film, Bj√∂rk's explanation is both generous and empathetic.‚Äù

item.description:
Sun above the piers this morning.

Judging from the number of people who also stopped and got their phones out, there should be hundreds of variations of this online by now.

media:content.media:description: An orange sun rises behind the piers. The camera has made this more orange than I saw with my eyes. It was a cooler colour. I hummed that theme from Star Wars when Luke returned to Tatooine, as I think it was more like that. But just the one sun here.

item.description:
Headed out with @JaneDallaway, binoculars around neck, to the local park hunting for C/2022 E3 (ZTF) ‚òÑÔ∏è

Too much light pollution to see it, but we did find a fox sniffing around.

media:content.media:description: A night photo showing a path through a park. You can just make out a hazy back-end of a fox. At the end of the path the camera image has inflated the street lights.

item.description: Such calm water this morning. At first I thought it was a low tide, but no: just the water hardly moving.

media:content.media:description: Looking towards Brighton‚Äôs West Pier viewed from the bandstand. Flat water with two paddle borders in the distance, who have passed in front of the pier.

item.description:
Augmented reality for #Parkinsons ‚Äî video, where the first ~minute is patient/carer feedback. Hope it gives lasting reliefü§û

http://24984399.hs-sites-eu1.com/share/hubspotvideo/58174640861
Had a tour of #DogsTrust Shoreham today.

media:content.media:description: A shelf stacked with a wide variety of dog food bowls.

item.description: Tonight at Brighton Astro, we learned that the Daily Star does a surprisingly large number of space-related front page stories.

media:content.media:description: A slide from a presentation showing 15 front covers of the Daily Star newspaper, including headlines such as ‚ÄúUFOs are REAL‚Äù

item.description: I‚Äôve spent today in Oxford. The building I was in was very nice, although my decoration choices would be different.

media:content.media:description: A painting of Margaret Thatcher, hanging on a wall.

item.description: Spent part of the morning hanging out with a chicken.

media:content.media:description: A fluffy cream coloured chicken, known as a ‚ÄúSilkie‚Äù.

item.description: An odd week, which included receiving a rather upsetting (but reasonable) bill for methadone (amongst other things), YouTube dive that ended in watching ‚ÄúUn, dos, tres... responda otra vez‚Äù (despite not speaking Spanish), and a 2 year old‚Äôs birthday party (tomorrow).

We tracked how the EV performed over the year. Roll on northern hemisphere summer‚Ä¶.

https://richard.dallaway.com/posts/2023-01-18-ev-range-2022/

media:content.media:description: Graph showing miles per 1 percent of battery drain, by month. It peaks (good) in the summer. Which is what is expected.

item.description: Some of the pebbles on the beach were frozen together this morning. Good to know that a few hours of -3 will do that.

media:content.media:description: On the beach in Brighton, before full sun rise, looking east towards the piers and i360. We see a broad beach of pebbles, and the orange glow of the sun starting to appear.

item.description:
‚ÄúWhy press?‚Äù, some guy shouted in passing as I pressed the crossing button. I pointed at the oncoming truck, saying ‚Äúbecause there a truck coming.‚Äù He continued walking, saying ‚Äúwhy press?‚Äù

Maybe I misunderstood the question.
A break from the wind and rain!

media:content.media:description: A view toward Brighton West Pier remains. A blue sky, a calm sea, but there‚Äôs a red danger sign on the beach still, asking people to keep away from the waves.
